snippet: The Colorado Senate began a marathon session on a range of new firearms restrictions in a state haunted by two mass shootings.
abstract: Colorado’s State Senate, after months of emotional debate, begins marathon session on  range of new firearms restrictions in a state haunted by two mass shootings; most significant bills up for debate have cleared Democrat-controlled Colorado House and are supported by Gov John W Hickenlooper, but margins are thin in State Senate, where debate over limiting size of ammunition magazines looms as one of most divisive issues.
lead_paragraph: The Colorado Senate began a marathon session on a range of new firearms restrictions in a state haunted by two mass shootings.

headline.seo: Colorado State Senate Takes Up Gun Restrictions
headline.main: Colorado Takes Up Gun Limits in Senate
headline.print_headline: Colorado Takes Up Gun Limits In Senate
